body.p: In 2009 the IASB observed that the changes to the definition of a business combination in the revisions to IFRS 3 Business Combinations (as revised in 2008) caused the accounting for the formation of a joint venture by the venturer to be within the scope of IFRIC 9. Similarly, the Board noted that common control transactions might raise the same issue depending on which level of the group reporting entity is assessing the combination.
